body_html:
yeah try to avoid a transpose if you can. they're not free.
…
On Apr 17, 2017 2:31 PM, "Androbin" ***@***.***> wrote: Which of the two would be faster or more readable or whatsoever? This is how it's done in python_speech_features.sigproc.framesig: indices_steps = array_ops.transpose(array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0, num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 0), [frame_length, 1])) But I figured out that, because expand_dims is already inserted explicitly: indices_steps = array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0, num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 1), [1, frame_length]) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body_text:
yeah try to avoid a transpose if you can. they're not free.
…
On Apr 17, 2017 2:31 PM, "Androbin" ***@***.***> wrote:
 Which of the two would be faster or more readable or whatsoever?

 This is how it's done in python_speech_features.sigproc.framesig:
 indices_steps = array_ops.transpose(array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0,
 num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 0), [frame_length, 1]))

 But I figured out that, because expand_dims is already inserted
 explicitly:
 indices_steps = array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0,
 num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 1), [1, frame_length])

 —
 You are receiving this because you were mentioned.

 .
body:
yeah try to avoid a transpose if you can. they're not free.

On Apr 17, 2017 2:31 PM, "Androbin" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Which of the two would be faster or more readable or whatsoever?
>
> This is how it's done in python_speech_features.sigproc.framesig:
> indices_steps = array_ops.transpose(array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0,
> num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 0), [frame_length, 1]))
>
> But I figured out that, because expand_dims is already inserted
> explicitly:
> indices_steps = array_ops.tile(array_ops.expand_dims(math_ops.range(0,
> num_frames * frame_step, frame_step), 1), [1, frame_length])
>
> —
